Posted By: KokoshoForPresident (4/20/2012 5:57:29 AM)

posts.post_content:
@MattyDrac  
  
Damage from abilities such as "Deal 1 damage to target creature or player" is not combat damage and will not trigger this ability. Combat damage is damage done by creature combat. This ability only triggers if Ashling attacks the opponent and deals any damage. Unfortunately [Power of Fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Power of Fire), while thematically related to Ashling the Extinguisher, doesn't work for the purpose of triggering her ability.  
  
As stated elsewhere in the comment thread [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) will make her unblockable, allowing her to deal direct combat damage.  
  
Also, this won't kill Progenitus because it has to target him.
posts.html:
@MattyDrac

Damage from abilities such as "Deal 1 damage to target creature or player" is not combat damage and will not trigger this ability. Combat damage is damage done by creature combat. This ability only triggers if Ashling attacks the opponent and deals any damage. Unfortunately Power of Fire, while thematically related to Ashling the Extinguisher, doesn't work for the purpose of triggering her ability.

As stated elsewhere in the comment thread Whispersilk Cloak will make her unblockable, allowing her to deal direct combat damage.

Also, this won't kill Progenitus because it has to target him.

posts.post_content: Hi everyone. If you put Fire of Power onto Ashling, the Extinguisher and you tapped it to deal one damage to target player. Would it still cause a player to sacrifice a creature. It came up in a game I was playing recently, and I got told that the player would only sacrifice a creature when Ashling deals combat damage as it states on his card. I was told that tapping the card and using the power of Fire ability to deal one damage to target player isn't dealing combat damge and as such doesn't cause the targeted player to sacrifice a card? Could someone please clarify this for me? thanks :)
posts.html:
Hi everyone. If you put Fire of Power onto Ashling, the Extinguisher and you tapped it to deal one damage to target player. Would it still cause a player to sacrifice a creature. It came up in a game I was playing recently, and I got told that the player would only sacrifice a creature when Ashling deals combat damage as it states on his card. I was told that tapping the card and using the power of Fire ability to deal one damage to target player isn't dealing combat damge and as such doesn't cause the targeted player to sacrifice a card? Could someone please clarify this for me? thanks :)

posts.post_content:
Son of a gun, this is AWESOME!!!! At worst, it's a 4/4 for 4 in black, which has pretty inefficient creatures (unless they have a huge drawback). But this is just insane!!! You get massive card advantage when she gets through, which isn't very hard to do in black, the color of [Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat) and such. But what really trips me out is that she wasn't played! Yeah, faeries and Jund did steal the thunder a bit, but still, it never saw any! I mean, sure, it's not incredibly overpowered, and I'm not gonna whine about powercreep, but it is a total bomb, and exactly what embodies a rare--either big and splashy, or really niche.  
  
4.5/5
posts.html:
